items.sentence: You shouldn\'t believe everything Tom tells you.
You shouldn\'t judge a person by his appearance.
You\'re already big enough to do it by yourself.
You\'re certainly looking fit as a fiddle today.
The problem is that solar energy costs too much.
There was only a little milk left in the bottle.
Tom came to our house several times last summer.
Tom celebrated his twentieth birthday last week.
Tom cleaned the top of the table with a wet rag.
Tom doesn\'t know what it\'s like to be in love.
I\'d like to borrow about three hundred dollars.
I\'d like to cancel my appointment for tomorrow.
I\'d like to find out where our meeting will be.
I\'d like to find out why Tom decided not to go.
I\'d like to give this to somebody we can trust.
I\'d like to know what time you plan to do that.
We traveled together last year for three months.
We used to get a lot of tourists from Australia.
We want to be on the first bus tomorrow morning.
We want to go back to Boston to visit Tom again.
